list.name: Changes
list.comment: I added a feature to filter the table view by months or weeks

task.summary: Default task
Initialized my new C195 Application project. In this initial commit I have established a connection to a client-side database.
I have added fxml views of the following: Login screen, Main Menu Screen, Customer Database Screen, and Add Customer screen
Created the appointment database view, and updated the customer database view with a return to menu button
Created the add apointment view
Added labels to each view
Updated look of the main menu
Refactored names of fxml & controller files for the login screen and main menu
Created OnLogn action event when clicking Login. Note: Must add logic to check for username/password later
Fixed a dependency issue with the JDBC driver
Created action event to return to the main menu from both the Customer & Appointment view
I Created the Customer class & created a method to pull data from the MySQL Customer Database and display it on the Customer table
Created a getCountry method within the Customer class that uses the Division ID within the SQL database to find the country
Created a getDivision method in the Customer class which would find the Division (which is the State/Province) using the Division ID in the SQL database
Created the Update Customer view. Also created the actionEvents so that I can navigate in and out of the Add Customer and Update Customer views.
I implemented a method to pull division data to display the appropriate list of State/Provinces on the ComboBox after selecting a Country in the country ComboBox
Created the Insert Customer method to add a customer to the database. However, there is a bug in which my division id is not properly updating. Must fix that next.
Created a new action event OnDivisionSelection, so that I can properly update the division id when selecting a division. This fixed my previous bug where the division_id was not updating properly.
Implemented the onDeleteCustomer method. A user can now select a customer from the table and delete them from the SQL database. The tableview will then update.
Implemented the Update Customer Method. It currently only takes selected customer data from the the customer table and sends it to the update customer form.
Updated the UpdateCustomer method to update the customers Division ID if the user changes the country and/or state/province from the combo boxes
Updated a bug in which the division combo box was not automatically loaded up with options when a user selects a customer to update.
The appointment view now loads data from the MySQL database into the table view
Updated the appointment table to include a Title Column which was previously missing
Updated the Contact Column to show the Contact name instead of Contact ID by running a query in the Appointment class
Created the initialize method in the add apointment class. This will intialize the combo boxes and spinners in the Add Appointment form
Fully implemented the Add Appointment feature
Began Implementing the Update Appointment method. I can now send data from an appointment selected on the table view over to the update appt form.
Updated the add/update methods. There was a bug in which duplicates of User ID or Customer ID would populate in the combo box. That is now fixed.
Successfully implemented the update appointment method.
Fixed a bug which was causing issues when updating the Customer ID or User ID in an appointment
Successfuly created Delete Appointment method
I added a feature to filter the table view by months or weeks
